Home → News

News

Suffolk library book returned after 52 years

Written by James Powell · Published May 22, 2019

The Metaphysical Poets by Jim Hunter was recently returned to Lowestoft Library, having been overdue since September 1967.

Lavenham Library launches opening hours consultation

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published May 17, 2019

Suffolk Libraries are asking people living in and around Lavenham their views on potential changes to the library’s opening hours.

Suffolk Libraries to celebrate Elmer Day

Written by James Powell · Published May 17, 2019

Several Suffolk Libraries will be celebrating the most colourful day of the year this month with the return of Elmer Day on Saturday 25 May ahead of Elmer's Big Parade Suffolk.

Clare Library to close for refurbishment

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published May 17, 2019

Clare Library will be closed for refurbishment from 1 - 8 July, reopening on Tuesday 9 July.

May half-term events at Suffolk Libraries

Written by Alice Violett · Published May 14, 2019

Are you looking for something to do during half-term? We've got children's events happening across our libraries.

Suffolk Libraries to take part in the 2019 Suffolk Show

Written by James Powell · Published May 7, 2019

Suffolk Libraries will be taking part in the Suffolk Show for the first time this year, showcasing the range of library services and experiences available across the county on Wednesday 29 and Thursday 30 May.

Suffolk Libraries to mark Mental Health Awareness Week 2019

Written by Sarah Lungley · Published May 7, 2019

Suffolk Libraries is supporting Mental Health Awareness Week 2019 (13 - 19 May) and celebrating all of the mental health services, groups and resources it offers.

Lesley’s Readers on BBC Radio Suffolk – book choice for June

Written by Alice Violett · Published May 2, 2019

This month Lesley will be discussing How it Ends, by Saskia Sarginson.

New Open Space group for young people at Chantry Library

Written by James Powell · Published Apr 18, 2019

Suffolk Libraries is launching a new health and wellbeing group for young people at Chantry Library in partnership with NSFT (Norfolk and Suffolk NHS Foundation Trust) and 4YP (Suffolk Young People’s Health project).

Easter opening hours for 2019

Written by Alice Violett · Published Apr 18, 2019

All of our libraries will be closed on Good Friday, Easter Sunday and Easter Monday (19, 21 and 22 April). They will be open as usual on Saturday 20 April.
